column2: ALABAMA DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: Alabama
column6: AL

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you increase the chance of a crash.
column6: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 2. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column6: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column8: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.

column2: 3. You should increase your following distance:
column4: at night or if it is raining.
column6: when the roads are slippery.

column2: 4. When passing a pedestrian who is walking on the road and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should:
column4: keep driving, you have the right-of-way.
column6: honk your horn to warn the pedestrian.
column8: slow down and let the vehicle pass first.

column2: 5. The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
column4: let them pass if it's safe to do so.
column6: flash your brake lights.
column8: always keep your eyes focused ahead of your car.

column2: 6. If you continually pass the other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction, you will:
column4: help prevent the chances of a crash occurring due to traffic congestion.
column6: get to your destination much faster.
column8: increase your chances of being involved in an accident.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Railroad Crossing
column6: One Way

column2: 8. Alcohol:
column4: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column6: makes it easier to make correct decisions.

column2: 9. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column6: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column8: The bus is about to stop.

column2: 10. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: the first rain after a dry spell.
column6: after it has been raining for an hour or more.
column8: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.

column2: 11. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: The driver on the left.
column6: No one.

column2: 12. Before stopping your vehicle on the roadway, drivers should:
column4: check their mirrors for traffic.
column6: place their foot on the accelerator.
column8: pump the brakes to check if they work properly.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Winding Road Ahead
column6: Persons with Disabilities Parking

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycle crossing
column6: Bicycles have the right-of-way
column8: This lane is reserved for bicyclists

column2: 15. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column6: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column8: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: There is a detour ahead
column6: The highway ahead is being repaired

column2: 17. When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
column4: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.
column6: speed up and proceed through the intersection.
column8: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.

column2: 18. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column4: on the opposite side of the street.
column6: if you have the green light.

column2: 19. When driving on a roadway with a single broken white line:
column4: you may cross the broken white line to change lanes.
column6: you may change lanes only if you are in the right lane.
column8: you may not cross the broken white line.

column2: 20. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column6: Motorcycles are hard to see.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Drive with caution and be ready to stop
column6: Slow down or stop
column8: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 22. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column6: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.

column2: 23. Roads with double solid yellow lines in the center indicate that passing is:
column4: not allowed in either direction.
column6: allowed only in your direction of travel.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column8: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn
column6: No U-turn

column2: 26. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: look and listen for trains.
column6: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

column2: 27. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column4: of two-way traffic
column6: of a reduction of lanes

column2: 28. The use of alcohol and/or drugs affects:
column4: concentration and reaction time.
column6: alertness and judgement.

column2: 29. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Hospital service
column6: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 30. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column4: round.
column6: diamond shaped.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road
column6: Side road ahead

column2: 32. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.

column2: 33. When the road is slippery, drivers should _________ their following distance.
column4: increase
column6: maintain

column2: 34. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column4: red, green and yellow
column6: green, yellow and red

column2: 35. When taking medication while driving, you should:
column4: follow other vehicles closely.
column6: consult your physicians and/or pharmacist regarding any prescription medication and its possible effects on driving.
column8: drive 20 MPH below the posted speed limit.

column2: 36. This sign means:
column4: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column6: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 37. When you see this sign you should:
column4: turn right.
column6: merge left.
column8: watch for traffic to the right.

column2: 38. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column4: work with
column6: fix

column2: 39. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the right lane must go straight.

column2: 40. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.
